title: Create DataFrame from Dictionary
description: Create a DataFrame from dict: {'name': ['Alice', 'Bob'], 'age': [25, 30]}.
setupCode: import pandas as pd

title: Get DataFrame Columns
description: Get the column names from the DataFrame as a list.
setupCode:

df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [1, 2], 'B': [3, 4], 'C': [5, 6]})
testCode:

df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [1, 2], 'B': [3, 4], 'C': [5, 6]})
{user_code}
print(columns)

title: Select Single Column
description: Select the 'name' column from the DataFrame.
setupCode:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie'], 'age': [25, 30, 35]})
expectedOutput:
0      Alice
1        Bob
2    Charlie
Name: name, dtype: object
testCode:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie'], 'age': [25, 30, 35]})
{user_code}
print(names)

title: Select Multiple Columns

testCode:

df = pd.DataFrame({'name': ['Alice', 'Bob'], 'age': [25, 30], 'city': ['NYC', 'LA']})

title: Add New Column
description: Add a new column 'salary' with values [50000, 60000, 70000].
setupCode:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie'], 'age': [25, 30, 35]})
expectedOutput:
name  age  salary
0    Alice   25   50000
1      Bob   30   60000
2  Charlie   35   70000
testCode:

df = pd.DataFrame({'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie'], 'age': [25, 30, 35]})
{user_code}
print(df)
hints: Assign directly to new column name

title: GroupBy and Aggregate

category
A    20.0
B    30.0
Name: value, dtype: float64

print(grouped)

title: Check for Null Values
description: Check if there are any null values in the DataFrame.

df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [1, 2, np.nan], 'B': [4, np.nan, 6]})
testCode:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [1, 2, np.nan], 'B': [4, np.nan, 6]})
{user_code}

hints: First any() checks columns, second checks if any column has nulls
